alert.note: Alert for Florence; Georgetown; Horry; Marion; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 6:53PM EDT until May 06 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... Northeastern Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... Southwestern Marion County in northeastern South Carolina... Northeastern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 653 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Brittons Neck to near Dongola to Oatland, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Pawleys Island, Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, Murrells Inlet, Little River Entrance, Socastee, Red Hill, Springmaid Pier, Garden City, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Cherry Grove Inlet, Horry, Loris, Johnsonville, Hemingway and Hickory Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
